text.text: This subpart establishes responsibilities for implementing Office of Federal Procurement Policy (OFPP) Policy Letter 93-1, Management Oversight of Service Contracting.

“Best practices,” as used in this subpart, means techniques that agencies may use to help detect problems in the acquisition, management, and administration of service contracts. Best practices are practical techniques gained from experience that agencies may use to improve the procurement process.

a.text: This subpart does not apply to services that are—

1.text: Obtained through personnel appointments and advisory committees;

2.text: Obtained through personal service contracts authorized by statute;

3.text: For construction as defined in 2.101; or

4.text: Obtained through interagency agreements where the work is being performed by in-house Federal employees.

b.text: Services obtained under contracts below the simplified acquisition threshold and services incidental to supply contracts also are excluded from the requirements of this subpart. However, good management practices and contract administration techniques should be used regardless of the contracting method.

text.text: Contracting officials should ensure that “best practices” techniques are used when contracting for services and in contract management and administration (see OFPP Policy Letter 93-1).
